description:
For the coming Thursday, I came across this performance at W:Hall (the Cultural House of commune Woluwe-Saint-Pierre). Contemporary dance on live music. Two dancers, one singer and a guitar-percussionist. I know it’s not the traditional type of live concert, but you may want to watch the trailer: http://vimeo.com/73214783

I find this type of synergy quite interesting. His previous performance of which they speak in the description (“Sources”) included Didier Laloy, who’s probably the coolest accordionist in Belgium. Tickets mount to 18.20 EUR with the reservation costs included: http://www.whalll.be/spectacle/double-par-la-cie-dessources/
name: DOUBLE, Nono Battesti – live contemporary dance and music

description:
Maybe this could be a good event to get the group started. Lots of different musical styles will be covered, it's on for a some hours and inexpensive.

  http://www.abconcerts.be/en/concerts/p/detail/the-sound-of-the-belgian-underground-2014-26-01-2014 

Considering the weather I would suggest we meet up inside. If I remember the layout correctly I would say the entrance hall on the left side in the back, shortly before the turn to the big auditorium and the café should be a convenient meeting point. There is also a type of table to stand at. This should also be the point to re-convene in the breaks as I assume not everyone will be there for the whole duration. The listing is on the AB website - you might want to check for updates.

Should any mayor problems occur with that I'll leave a message here and I will check back regularly with the app.  I just sent a message to everyone who said yes with a bit more (personal) detail, so I hope all will work out okay.
name: The Sound of the Belgian Underground

description:
Whether you know him as Donald Glover,(actor, writer and stand-up comedian), Troy Barnes (his alter ego on Community) or Childish Gambino (Glover's hip hop persona), you can't deny that the man knows how to entertain a crowd.

Childish Gambino will be at VK tonight (sorry for the late notice), I'll be there - hope to see you guys there as well!

Cheers,
Melissa

description:
Mongolian folk music blended with punk-rock and coming from China. The story goes that after hearing throat singing for the first time, the singer went to a journey to Mongolia to discover his heritage and met his band colleagues there. Throat singing, traditional instruments, adaptations of Mongolian folk songs and outfits of men of the steppes even though they live in the metropolis of Beijing.

Sounds both fun and interesting. There are youtube videos on the AB website. I wouldn’t know what to post here, as they are a premiere for me. Tickets are 12 EUR, in AB Club. http://www.abconcerts.be/en/concerts/p/detail/hanggai-17-02-2014#

description:
The older I get the more I get into electronic music. I am doing something wrong ;-). I bought a ticket for Gesaffelstein the day the concert was announced and expecting it to be sold out quickly. It hasn't yet, so I'd be happy to have company.

http://www.abconcerts.be/en/concerts/p/detail/gesaffelstein-18-02-2014 

http://www.gesaffelstein.com/

update 25 January: sold out.

update 17 February: just sent message to those who RSVP'd yes with meeting suggestions, please contact me if you have any problems or a late addition to the concert.

description:
Midlake are a US indie folk band who have recently veered in a somewhat psychedelic direction since their previous front-man left.

More details about the band and their upcoming gig at Ancienne Belgique on the following page of AB:
http://www.abconcerts.be/en/concerts/p/detail/midlake-02-03-2014#
from which you can also proceed to buy a ticket.
A link to more music off their latest album is here:


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1aH3ikDde8I

We can meet at AB's Cafe/Resto 30-60 minutes before the support act starts (provisionally the support will start at 8pm but that could be revised by AB 24 hours before the gig). A second meeting time for those at who don't make it to the support is probably a good idea. This can also be at the AB Cafe/Resto about 20 minutes before the main act (Midlake) starts, and will provisionally be around 9.15pm I expect, subject to revision 24 hours before the show according to the latest info from AB.

Please buy a ticket as soon as possible after RSVP'ing, to avoid the possibility that the show sells out in the mean time.
name: Midlake at Ancienne Belgique

description:
Let's gather for the first Belgian concert of Mutual Benefit who recently released the most delicate and fragile folk album of 2013 !
11€ for presales, 14€ at the event

"Jordan Lee has spent the last few years moving from Ohio to Austin to Boston, and most recently Brooklyn, running the wonderful Kassette Klub label, touring with friends’ groups, and leading an amorphous project called Mutual Benefit, a one-man-band or a sprawling collective, depending on where he is and who is around that day. After self-releasing two limited cassettes and playing scores of house shows, Lee completed his debut album, Love’s Crushing Diamond, a record of lush, watery, pop songs, pieced together over the past several years and inspired by the kinetic energy, goodbyes, and blurred landscapes of life on the road. The songs are heartfelt and powerful with Lee’s fragile and beautiful voice as the centerpiece, and the recordings are an instantly engaging blend of high and low fidelity, mixing lush studio productions, featuring keys, guitar, violin and banjo, with clattering homemade percussion and found sounds. While the album is certainly Lee’s brainchild, the recordings are very much a collaborative effort featuring contributions by friends and others met along the way."
name: Mutual Benefit @ Botanique

description:
Time for another fix of those desert guitar blues. This hypnotic sound really gets under my skin and fires my imagination. I saw them in Australia in 2009 but the founding member and main guitarist/vocalist couldn't hack the long plane trip and stayed in his desert home. Now I have another chance.

description:
Elysian Fields is an American band based in Brooklyn, New York, founded in 1995 by the co-composers Jennifer Charles (vocals, instruments) and Oren Bloedow (guitar). Their music has sometimes been described as "noir rock",[1] due to its sultry, dark and mysterious inflections, be it sonically or lyrically. The band uses mainly acoustic instruments, predominantly guitar, piano, bass and drums, with the occasional appearance of eastern instruments, classical strings, and subtle electronics, the focal point being the voice of Charles in the forefront.

I only know this group for 1 month, and I'm already a fan of pretty much all their albums. I can't explain the style better as the description above from wikipedia. Really looking forward to this concert.

15 euro in presale:

description:
Hey guys!

On Saturday 10/05 there will be a bunch of awesome living room concerts in Saint-Gilles. It's actually a festival called Home Plugged and features bands such as Yellow Ostrich (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4f-LnU67mM ; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RrLyvJJypvM) and others. Tickets cost 10€ and are sold at the Elektrocution record store in Rue des Pierres, or at the house itself where the concerts will take place (Rue Moris 31 in Saint-Gilles). There will also be a barbecue :)

I'm definitely going, but I would love some company! Anyone interested, just let me know!

Cheers,
Melissa

Meeting arrangements: I (Chris) am going to arrive at 6.00 and grab a bite at AB Cafee/Resto. Between 6.00 and 6.30 you can find me there, wearing blue jeans blue t-shirt and maybe a turquoise shirt over that. I will also send you my mobile number by email.

At 6.30 when the main hall opens, I'll go and see if there is any back balcony seating available. If there is I want to sit there and hold seats for me and whoever else wants one. If you want me to keep you a seat you should post me a message or phone me.

If there are no seats I will wait in the AB Cafe/Resto the foyer area instead. Phone me to find me if necessary.

Late news: I have one free ticket with me because Ioana can't come. If you have a friend who would like to join, post a comment to this page or contact me. First in, first served.

A tip for concerts at musiekpublique: tickets for members are about 4 euros cheaper; at 10 euros for membership you only need to go to 3 concerts per year to save money; you can get membership and concert ticket at reduced price at the same time by buying a combo ticket.

We can meet at the foyer of the venue for a drink at 7.30. Note that the venue is accessed not directly from the street, but via Molière Galerie which has an entrance on Square du Bastion behind the Metro entrance at Porte de Namur.

description:
Who’s up for a crossover night? Flying Horseman(BE), My Cheap Little Dictaphone (BE) and will all play music to special films at Flagey. Some will be made by the musicians (who are sometimes directors, I guess) themselves, others come straight from the archives of Cinematek. I always like the pairing of film and music and these are cool bands, so nothing can go wrong, right? The bands:

MCLD is a Liège grown indie pop band. This is wat Botanique sais about them: “Propelled by the hit song «What Are You Waiting For» (featured in the video game « Little Big Planet2 »), the group embarked on a tour lasting more than two years that took them as far afield as Canada and the UK, where the album earned rave reviews and was awarded Album of The Week by the Sunday Times.”
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I6bhObmRI84 Flying Horseman is a collective from Antwerp with an excellent live reputation. They make the kind of dark bluesy songs that go well with, let’s say, moving pictures and Belgian beer ;-). BTW: there's another meetup for their concert on the 6th apparently :). https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M9XStplWVRs The last band is a krautrock/psychedelic band from Chili. One of their members has made a (weird, according to Flagey) movie and they’re going to play a live soundtrack to it. Seems like that could be an interesting experiences.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-j6egi1wqlo Price: €12/€15 (although I’m not able to book any tickets right now, due to what seems to be a technical malfunction)

Any other music/cinema lovers out there that are interested in this gig?

More info on http://www.brff.be/en/program/item/1238-cine-concert?be=534
name: My Little Cheap Dictaphone, Flying Horseman, Follakzoid - film crossover

description:
[Spotify Bio]

Injecting a wider range of emotions into their music than most of their guitar-based British peers, Elbow have been known to refer to their orchestral, grandiose sound as "prog without the solos." The members of the band -- vocalist Guy Garvey, drummer Richard Jupp, organist Craig Potter, guitarist Mark Potter, and bassist Pete Turner -- met during the early '90s while attending college in Bury. After moving several miles south to Manchester proper, the band went through a couple of developmental stages before attracting the interest of Island Records, which signed the group in 1998.

Island was bought out by Universal several months later, though, and Elbow found themselves dropped from the label as a result. After a partnership with EMI also dissolved, the guys linked up with local independent label Uglyman and released two EPs, Newborn and Any Day Now. The acclaimed EPs gained the band a contract with V2, which released 2001's equally tipped Asleep in the Back. The record was short-listed as a nominee for 2001's Mercury Prize and was issued in the States in early 2002.

[Youtube Links]

Mirrorball:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sq10PhUG9VQ


Grounds for Divorce: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNIXPQoz0s0

[Concert Info & Tickets]

http://www.ticketnet.be/en/manifestation/elbow-ticket/idmanif/9881

I got a standing ticket for myself because seats, bleh. -_-
Let me know if anyone of you are interested.
name: Elbow at Palais 12

description:
Out Loud!

Reptile Youth (DK) just released their second album. 'Rivers that run for a sea that is gone' is the first recording in two years. Meanwhile the band has been on tour through Europe non-stop, playing over 150 shows in more than ten countries.

Mads Damsgaard Kristiansen and Esben Valløen started their musical career in 2009 under the name Reptile & Retard but soon renamed themselves Reptile Youth. They wouldn't feel comfortable being pigeonholed at any time, or how Mads puts it: “ We simply want to be more than 10 MP3s on your computer. That’s also why we changed the name to Reptile Youth back then. We would rather be considered a movement, a kind of frame within many things can happen.”

A movement, called Reptile Youth, spreading from Denmark into mainland Europe, it arrived in The Netherlands during the summer of 2013 where Reptile Youth played a show at Welcome to the Village. A show that resulted into a massive beach race into the ocean, when the band jumped offstage and were followed by a large portion of the crowd. The non-swimmers couldn’t believe what they were seeing and were left photographing the scene.

"Still, at its best, this deserves, even demands, to be heard. To be stolen or bought." - The Guardian

http://www.beursschouwburg.be/en/event/6036/2014-06-17/#!6080

YOUTUBE:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MbHLy9aA7CY 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ZtlmVoxU6Y

description:
Anne Niepold plays eloquently beguiling accordion melodies in her waltz arrangements featuring flute, oboe, trumpet, trombone, double bass and drums.

 The venue Muziek Publique has a reputation for high-quality music and this looks like it will be no exception. Remember you can save substantially on tickets by becoming a member. You only need to attend three shows per year to make it worth while. (This show is 8€ for members, 12€ for non-members, and annual membership is 10€)

http://www.muziekpublique.be/news/concerts-39/article/anne-niepold-musette-is-not-dead-3188?id_evenement=1549&lang=en

"Anne Niepold shouts it from the rooftops: Musette is not Dead! And she has made this into the title and the motto of her new album, whose launch she will celebrate at Muziekpublique in your company. This concert is unprecedented, since all the musicians appearing on the CD will be present to relive these tunes for musette-style accordion in a dynamic and energized fashion. Away with your prejudices! Generally speaking you are perhaps turned off by all the tra-la-la, by musette-style waltzes and by accordions...? So much the better! For Anne Niepold plays her way out of all the clichés to deliver a wholly personal vision of a universe where all barriers are swept away and where musette can co-exist with swing, brass and woodwind with accordion, popular music with original compositions. With this second album she brings together – with everything in ¾ time – those nostalgic for the Balajo dance-hall, diatonic-lovers and jazz fans. Recorded by a highly original septet, Musette is not Dead (MIND) charms by the elegance and power of its melodies and surprises by the daring and refinement of its arrangements. And if the secret of this virtuoso accordionist lies in the seriousness with which she tackles the humour that this astonishing album exudes…? Do you MIND?"

venue.name: Muziek Publique
venue.address_1: Molière Galerie Porte de Namur, Bastion Square 3

name: Anne Niepold: Musette Is Not Dead

description:
Joanne Shaw TaylorTaylor embodies all the elements of modern blues, even if she sings with a distinctively British accent. Given her extraordinary dexterity as a guitarist and well-developed vocal chops, Taylor was already a sensation on the blues festival circuit in both the U.S. and Great Britain when only in her mid-twenties. Taylor caught the blues bug as a young teenager growing up in the Birmingham area. She heard guitarists Stevie Ray Vaughan, Albert Collins, and Jimi Hendrix and knew then that was the kind of music she wanted to pursue, eventually full-time.

She's my favourite female blues artist, and I'm so happy I can see her twice this year (also at Blues Peer). Great songs and an amazing voice.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bJihqefxBa8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XgimVVNKgHs
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oXJm5qPxYv4

Tickets @ https://tickets231.ticketmatic.com/addevent.php?a=BpVXpBfYiCQ&e=Pnb0otOqXEA&s=80cswBbInpo&l=en
name: Joanne Shaw Taylor

description:
Nicole Atkins (born October 1, 1978) is an American singer-songwriter born in Neptune, NJ. She has released 3 studio albums, “Neptune City” (2007), “Mondo Amore” (2011) and “Slow Phaser” (2014)

Nicole Atkins’ music is a blend of the decades and an expression of the images that many of us share in our memories. Both playful and tragic and never cynical. Nicole draws upon the documents left us by heroes such as Roy Orbison, Phil Spector, Nina Simone, The Kinks, David Lynch, as much as her own experiences learning from the new heroes like Stephen Malkmus, Wilco, Lucinda Williams. She grew up in Shark River Hills, a middle class enclave within Neptune overlooking the Shark River. Atkins has cited the river (technically a bay) as a major inspiration for her music, particularly the imagery of “the river in the rain” found in the title track on her album Neptune City. She started playing piano when she was 9 and taught herself to play guitar at 13. She eschewed more popular acts of the day for musical groups her parents listened to, such as The Ronettes and Johnny Cash. She has cited The Sundays’ Harriet Wheeler as a major early influence.

She started playing in pick-up bands and doing gigs at local coffeehouses while attending St. Rose High School in the nearby town of Belmar.

After high school, Atkins moved to Charlotte, North Carolina to study illustration at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte.She ingrained herself within the city’s independent music scene, discovering bands like Superchunk and Uncle Tupelo.
name: Nicole Atkins @ Botanique

description: Gregory Alan Isakov has spent his entire life traveling, and as a result, his travels have impacted his songwriting; his songs tell stories of miles and landscapes and the search for a sense of place. Music has been a constant force in his life, as he says, “I’ve always had this sense about music and writing, that I sort of have to do it. Like I’ll implode without it. I probably wouldn’t do it if I felt any other way.”

description:
One of my favorite singers Buika, will be in Brussels on 5 of November. If anyone is interested here are some more info about the singer:
"The Spanish-African singer Concha Buika sings an inspired mixture of jazz, flamenco, blues, soul, and more. Her husky but tender voice has been compared to those of Nina Simone, Chavela Vargas, and Cesaria Evora. Buika has worked with a wide array of artists, including Path Metheny, Anoushka Shankar, Chick Corea, Charles Aznavour, and Nelly Furtado. La noche más larga ("The Longest Night") is the title of her seventh album, on which she breaks through the boundaries around flamenco, where her musical roots lie." The tickets can be bought at the Bozar or through the following link:
http://www.bozar.be/activity.php?id=14786

as well as a link for one of her famous songs


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=574NJ-966a8

description:
Kasabian took the British press by storm in the early 2000s by mixing traces of the Stone Roses, Happy Mondays, and Primal Scream with Oasis-sized confidence and DJ Shadow-influenced electronics. Named after Linda Kasabian, Charles Manson's getaway driver turned state witness, the Leicester-based group also stole a page from the Band by moving into a remote farmhouse to brew its music. Communal life and a slew of shared influences produced an electronic, rock-oriented sound that harked back to the Madchester days of baggy pants and druggy dancing. Kasabian expanded that sound on later albums, but the band's foundation remained rooted in swaggering, fragmented dance textures and boisterous rock & roll.

My favourite British rockband since Oasis & Blur.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PAu52W7k1c
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6k7VldHaIbE
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=agVpq_XXRmU

Tickets @ http://www.sherpa.be/enUS/Music/Pop-Rock/Kasabian/
name: Kasabian @ Forest National

description:
Chet Faker (born Nicholas James Murphy) is an Australian electronica musician. In 2012 he signed to Downtown Records in the United States and issued an extended play, Thinking in Textures. In October that year he won 'Breakthrough Artist of the Year' and Thinking in Textures won 'Best Independent Single/EP' at the Australian Independent Records Awards. In January 2013 the work won 'Best Independent Release' at the Rolling Stone Australia Awards for 2012. His debut album 'Built on Glass' is out April 2014 via Future Classic / Downtown.

***
The show has been sold out for a while now - so please don't ask how to get tickets for the show.
But those who already have a ticket, let me know and we can meet before for a drink :)
name: Chet Faker @ Botanique

23:30 curfew

12€/15€

http://www.vkconcerts.be/en/concerts/esben-witch
http://www.facebook.com/events/1485422908388747

 

Esben & The Witch are a British three piece rock band consisting of Rachel Davies (vocals, bass, percussion), Thomas Fisher (guitar), and Daniel Copeman (drums, electronics - formerly guitar). The band themselves described their music as "nightmare pop". The band's music has been used in a variety of TV shows across the world, most notably "Marching Song" on Beavis and Butt-Head and in a number of show trailers. The band was signed with Matador Records but made the switch to their own label Nostromo Records this year with the release of new album "A New Nature".
name: Esben and the Witch @ Vk

description:
I discovered this contemporary classical string quartet in the 80s when they'd already been around for 15 years. This is my first opportunity to hear them live. Kronos Quartet is touring the world for their 40th anniversary celebrations. "Kronos Quartet can quite definitely be called legendary. In ’73 this string quartet started out with interpretations of the work of composers like Mozart and Haydn, but along the way they left the classical path and joined forces with minimalists of the American school, like Terry Riley and Philip Glass."
http://www.abconcerts.be/en/agenda/events/ab-ars-musica-present-kronos-quartet-performing-aheym-bryce-dessner-string-quartet-n6-philip-glass/6107/
